data.field: pop - remove the last element from an array and return it

Pops and returns the last value of the array, shortening the array by 1. Has a similar effect to 

    $tmp = $ARRAY[$#ARRAY--];

If there are no elements in the array, returns the undefined value. If ARRAY is omitted, pops the @ARGV array in the main program, and the @_ array in subroutines, just like [perlfunc:shift|shift()].
